column1: Other causes include: - Anorexia nervosa or bulimia - Bleeding - Genetic disorders that cause iron buildup in the body - Head trauma - Infections and swelling (inflammation) - Malnutrition
Symptoms are usually due to the hormones that are missing.
Kallmann's syndrome is a type of hypothalamic dysfunction that occurs in men.
The doctor will perform a physical examination and ask about your symptoms.
Treatment depends on the cause of the hypothalamic dysfunction: - For tumors, surgery or radiation may be needed.
